soc.server.database

Class BCrypt

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.server.database.BCrypt

  • public class BCrypt
extends java.lang.Object
    BCrypt implements OpenBSD-style Blowfish password hashing using the scheme described in "A Future-Adaptable Password Scheme" by Niels Provos and David Mazieres.

    This password hashing system tries to thwart off-line password cracking using a computationally-intensive hashing algorithm, based on Bruce Schneier's Blowfish cipher. The work factor of the algorithm is parameterised, so it can be increased as computers get faster.

    Usage is really simple. To hash a password for the first time, call the hashpw method with a random salt, like this:

    String pw_hash = BCrypt.hashpw(plain_password, BCrypt.gensalt());

    To check whether a plaintext password matches one that has been hashed previously, use the checkpw method:

    if (BCrypt.checkpw(candidate_password, stored_hash))
        System.out.println("It matches");
    else
        System.out.println("It does not match");

    The gensalt() method takes an optional parameter (log_rounds) that determines the computational complexity of the hashing:

    String strong_salt = BCrypt.gensalt(10)
    String stronger_salt = BCrypt.gensalt(12)

    The amount of work increases exponentially (2**log_rounds), so each increment is twice as much work. The default log_rounds is 10, and the valid range is 4 to 30.

    Version:
    0.4
    Author:
    Damien Miller

    • Method Detail

      • crypt_raw

        public byte[] crypt_raw(byte[] password,
                        byte[] salt,
                        int log_rounds,
                        int[] cdata)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Perform the central password hashing step in the bcrypt scheme
        Parameters:
        password - the password to hash
        salt - the binary salt to hash with the password
        log_rounds - the binary logarithm of the number of rounds of hashing to apply
        cdata - the plaintext to encrypt
        Returns:
        an array containing the binary hashed password
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if log_rounds not within valid range GENSALT_MIN_LOG2_ROUNDS to GENSALT_MAX_LOG2_ROUNDS, or salt.length != BCRYPT_SALT_LEN

      • hashpw

        public static java.lang.String hashpw(java.lang.String password,
                                      java.lang.String salt)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Hash a password using the OpenBSD bcrypt scheme
        Parameters:
        password - the password to hash
        salt - the salt to hash with (perhaps generated using BCrypt.gensalt)
        Returns:
        the hashed password
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if log_rounds not within valid range GENSALT_MIN_LOG2_ROUNDS to GENSALT_MAX_LOG2_ROUNDS, or salt.length != BCRYPT_SALT_LEN, or salt is missing its version (2) or number of rounds or its optional revision != 'a'; if round count is 13, salt should begin with $2$13$ or $2a$13$

      • gensalt

        public static java.lang.String gensalt(int log_rounds,
                                       java.security.SecureRandom random)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generate a salt for use with the BCrypt.hashpw() method
        Parameters:
        log_rounds - the log2 of the number of rounds of hashing to apply - the work factor therefore increases as 2**log_rounds.
        random - an instance of SecureRandom to use; not null
        Returns:
        an encoded salt value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if log_rounds > GENSALT_MAX_LOG2_ROUNDS
        See Also:
        gensalt(), gensalt(int)

      • gensalt

        public static java.lang.String gensalt(int log_rounds)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generate a salt for use with the BCrypt.hashpw() method
        Parameters:
        log_rounds - the log2 of the number of rounds of hashing to apply - the work factor therefore increases as 2**log_rounds.
        Returns:
        an encoded salt value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if log_rounds > GENSALT_MAX_LOG2_ROUNDS
        See Also:
        gensalt(), gensalt(int, SecureRandom)

      • gensalt

        public static java.lang.String gensalt()
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Generate a salt for use with the BCrypt.hashpw() method, selecting a reasonable default for the number of hashing rounds to apply
        Returns:
        an encoded salt value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if log_rounds > GENSALT_MAX_LOG2_ROUNDS
        See Also:
        gensalt(int), gensalt(int, SecureRandom)

      • checkpw

        public static boolean checkpw(java.lang.String plaintext,
                              java.lang.String hashed)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Check that a plaintext password matches a previously hashed one. Calls hashpw(String, String).
        Parameters:
        plaintext - the plaintext password to verify
        hashed - the previously-hashed password
        Returns:
        true if the passwords match, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if hashed doesn't meet hashpw(plaintext, hashed)'s conditions; see that method for details
